Doesn't this rely on the starting material being sugar with vanillin powder added to it like a coating? if "vanilla sugar" is homogeneously melted sugar and vanillin ground up, you'll lose most of your yield to the methanol not physically having access to the vanillin.
It also seems like this would be a good place to use a soxhlet extractor. You could literally run it until everything in the extraction area ended up in the collection flask. Doesn't matter since at that point all of the vanillin should be in solution and the sugar would have crashed out on its own as the concentration increased.

@nilered I realize this is an old video and you my be on to bigger and better projects but thought you may still be interested. I was reading a paper "Vanillin Synthesis from 4-Hydroxybenzaldehyde". 4-hydroxybenzaldehyde isn't super expensive. A bromination of 4-hydroxybenzaldehyde will result in 3-bromo-4-hydroxybenzaldehyde then you substitue Br for COH to produce 4-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzaldehyde , but it warns to only run bromofication process for 30s because you will end up with 3,5-bromo-4-hydroxybenzaldehyde and an end product of 4-hydroxy-3,5-methoxybenzaldehyde.
